alert.note: Alert for Pearl River; Walthall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern St. Helena, northwestern St. Tammany, northeastern Livingston, Tangipahoa and Washington Parishes, southeastern Walthall and northwestern Pearl River Counties through 1230 PM CDT... At 1200 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wilmer, or near Franklinton, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hammond, Bogalusa, Covington, Franklinton, Amite, Ponchatoula, Amite City, Abita Springs, Independence, Varnado, Roseland, Albany, Madisonville, Folsom, Springfield, Sun, Montpelier, Enon, Crossroads and Mount Herman. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 27 and 68. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 20 and 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for southeastern Louisiana...and southern Mississippi.
